commit_message:
Ensure tuned_custom_profile is used for tuned role

The role currently uses custom_profile which is undefined.
Rename custom_profile to tuned_custom_profile so that an
operator can actually use custom tuned profiles.

Change-Id: Ibb2642a981101d7a6a4cfce06d20b478190a4cd3
(cherry picked from commit a7908e624ef6569979bd69c1d3c87d22a070599f)

New test case: "test_port_with_fixed_ip"

Scenario based test case, that is planned to check the ability
to create the VM using Port with predifined Fixed IP.

Change-Id: I2bb7f271e59defbfc2aba5ee6695a74f496a04bf

commit_message:
Update Ranger Secrets for Helm v3

Helm v3 doesnt like null secrets.
Attempting to switch to empty string,
testing for v2 compatibility before
merging for v3 use. Also removed references
to deprecated code cloud repo usage for
storing heat templates.

Change-Id: I3d06c77d02b398253f22b847f68bb359e0c2ec2f

commit_message:
[TRAIN] Default ceph export config-download dir to mistral

When [1] was backported it should have used the defaults
that train has which were removed by the work on bug
1874432. This patch is going directly into Train only so
that Train users may have a better default.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/754402

Change-Id: I943723a04d2a8cc1bb46ba0c55d395410c14486c
Closes-Bug: #1905471

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

For Train also fix the reqs to pass the checks.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: Ib13e4f07aa6ee76be329d9eec9180c1fe31b9593
(cherry picked from commit f8f13e7d0937f1ef51fed36f3a0e6e67f1d1add0)

[{'created': '2020-11-18 17:54:02.000000000', 'message': 'Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)
'}, {'created': '2020-12-21 10:55:45.000000000', 'message': 'Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Also:
merges https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/763623
into this patch to not have a dedicated fix needed.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Also:
merges https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/763623
into this patch to not have a dedicated fix needed.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)

commit_message:
Move stable stein job definition in tree

Tempest is removing the stable/stein job as it is
in EM state
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/768118

but stackviz still need to test it as stackviz need to
support all branhces even they are in EM state.

Change-Id: I51defe3c16919663a845a338c006300168d8462c

commit_message:
Notification drivers need to be a list

Convert the NotificationDriver to a comma_delimited_list.
This will still not break existing templates because passing
a string is still completely valid. This is done so that the hiera keys
will be passed down as lists.

The oslo::messaging::notifications::driver expects a list anyway so this
won't break things and will allow us to actually specify multiple
notification drivers correctly. The change that allowed
oslo::notifications to use both strings and lists is
If65946412b42e0919456ed92fdd8e3788ad67872 (Messaging notifications
should be set as a list)

Related-Bug: #1851629

Change-Id: I24c860cd3121e5c307233864818ca86967ff6d72

subject: compute: Don't detach volumes when RescheduledException raised without retry

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/768194/3 : FAILURE in 2h 50m 39s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-22 11:43:06.000000000', 'message': "compute: Don't detach volumes when RescheduledException raised without retry

I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0 introduced a crude call to
_cleanup_volumes within _do_build_and_run_instance when handling a
RescheduledException exception raised from _build_and_run_instance
without any retry information provided from the scheduler.

This situation can arise when using the 'availability_zone' parameter to
skip the scheduler by providing both a target availability_zone and host
in the format of `$availability_zone:$host`. If the instance is unable
to build on the compute the failure will eventually lead to
_cleanup_volumes calling DriverVolumeBlockDevice.detach that will either
detach (cinderv2) or delete the associated volume attachments (cinderv3)
moving the volume to an `available` state, assuming it isn't
multi-attached etc.

The issue with this is that this behaviour is in stark contrast to that
of volumes associated with instances that have failed to schedule. In
that case the volumes remain marked as reserved and associated with the
ERROR'd out instance until the instance itself is deleted.

This change aims to align both cases by removing the call to
_cleanup_volumes and in doing so keeping any volumes in a `reserved`
state until the underlying instance is deleted.

Note that leaving these volumes associated with ERROR'd out instances is
now safe after I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117 landed and now
ensures that ports and volumes associated with such an instance are
correctly cleaned up.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as I26395d57bd4ba55276b7514baa808f9888639e11
isn't present on stable/train.

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Closes-Bug: #1899649
Change-Id: I5dda9e8bca5fbaae77ece12b67176945ca4d9a4c

commit_message:
compute: Don't detach volumes when RescheduledException raised without retry

I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0 introduced a crude call to
_cleanup_volumes within _do_build_and_run_instance when handling a
RescheduledException exception raised from _build_and_run_instance
without any retry information provided from the scheduler.

This situation can arise when using the 'availability_zone' parameter to
skip the scheduler by providing both a target availability_zone and host
in the format of `$availability_zone:$host`. If the instance is unable
to build on the compute the failure will eventually lead to
_cleanup_volumes calling DriverVolumeBlockDevice.detach that will either
detach (cinderv2) or delete the associated volume attachments (cinderv3)
moving the volume to an `available` state, assuming it isn't
multi-attached etc.

The issue with this is that this behaviour is in stark contrast to that
of volumes associated with instances that have failed to schedule. In
that case the volumes remain marked as reserved and associated with the
ERROR'd out instance until the instance itself is deleted.

This change aims to align both cases by removing the call to
_cleanup_volumes and in doing so keeping any volumes in a `reserved`
state until the underlying instance is deleted.

Note that leaving these volumes associated with ERROR'd out instances is
now safe after I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117 landed and now
ensures that ports and volumes associated with such an instance are
correctly cleaned up.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as I26395d57bd4ba55276b7514baa808f9888639e11
isn't present on stable/train.

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Closes-Bug: #1899649
Change-Id: I5dda9e8bca5fbaae77ece12b67176945ca4d9a4c
(cherry picked from commit 26c46a409fa3a75f11fe0ecfc3cf1a8e77da8f51)
(cherry picked from commit d0daac2c089b015c28e02e7965afdb22f08e42a1)
(cherry picked from commit 643d01970ec2dc8e9c15612af7279f9a5df57745)

commit_message:
Move stable repo to new location

Default stable repo for 2.16 is set to [0] that is deprecated
according to [1]. Setting stable repo to new location manually.

[0] https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com
[1] https://helm.sh/blog/new-location-stable-incubator-charts/

Change-Id: I36e8598fcc2c787dd1561777149fb498269a797d

commit_message:
Change 'Volume' to 'Block Storage'

In volume*.rst files, 'Volume' should be instead of 'Block Storage'.

Change-Id: Iafc8bfa19e87edf1ffad2340c75e9d867042cae5

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: Ib13e4f07aa6ee76be329d9eec9180c1fe31b9593
(cherry picked from commit f8f13e7d0937f1ef51fed36f3a0e6e67f1d1add0)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: Ib13e4f07aa6ee76be329d9eec9180c1fe31b9593
(cherry picked from commit f8f13e7d0937f1ef51fed36f3a0e6e67f1d1add0)

Delete does not make sense to me, we do not create quotas, we set them, so we should unset them.  Presumably then we might also want to unset only specific quotas rather than all at once too.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-10-07 00:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the code looks fine to me, but dtroyers comments need to be addressed'}, {'account_id': 14615, 'date': '2016-10-07 09:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dean, actually, quota delete command is not really deletes quotas. In neutron [1], nova [2] and cinder [3] this command is used to clear per-project quota limits. After running this command, the quota values for the project will be reset to the default values.
So, may be, notes and documentation for this patch looks not very obvious and we should rewrite it?

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/cli-networking-advanced-quotas.html
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html#nova-quota-delete
[3] http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/cli-cinder-quotas.html'}, {'account_id': 14615, 'date': '2016-10-12 15:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14615, 'date': '2016-12-23 11:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-23 12:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

commit_message:
Introduce 'quota unset' command

This patch adds quota unset command that resets quotas for compute,
volume and network to their default values for the current project
or for project, that is specified after '--project' argument.

User can now revert any of the following resource quotas to their
default value using the '--compute', '--volume', and '--network' flags.
If no flags specified then all quotas will be reverted back to their
default values.

Change-Id: I2348270fbbe26ec2970e1374c250f84d4340238e
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-client-quota
Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I264911c5364d2af6acef3797c011913718d2f96d
(cherry picked from commit c8efcfada77c4d5a7757f927f5b02e8540bd6aad)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I264911c5364d2af6acef3797c011913718d2f96d
(cherry picked from commit c8efcfada77c4d5a7757f927f5b02e8540bd6aad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-28 23:00:28.000000000', 'message': "Replace pkg_resources with importlib-metadata

pkg_resources is slow an inefficient particularly when using entry
points. Thankfully there is an upstream replacement that will end up in
python 3.8's stdlib called importlib-metadata which has been backported
to older python versions.

Use importlib-metadata to manage entrypoints in an effort to improve osc
startup time.

Note that if there are other useages of pkg_resources pulled in by osc
dependencies we'll have to weed those out as well before we start seeing
performance improvements. Have to start somewhere though.

Change-Id: Id6e908cee0701ed16481086d53af2e7546a939af

commit_message:
Replace pkg_resources with importlib-metadata

pkg_resources is slow an inefficient particularly when using entry
points. Thankfully there is an upstream replacement that will end up in
python 3.8's stdlib called importlib-metadata which has been backported
to older python versions.

Use importlib-metadata to manage entrypoints in an effort to improve osc
startup time.

Note that if there are other useages of pkg_resources pulled in by osc
dependencies we'll have to weed those out as well before we start seeing
performance improvements. Have to start somewhere though.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711282
Change-Id: Id6e908cee0701ed16481086d53af2e7546a939af

Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

commit_message:
Create 'use_all_resource_revisions' for Gnocchi collector

This option is useful when using Gnocchi with the patch introduced in
https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/pull/1059. That patch can
cause queries to return more than one entry per granularity (
timespan), according to the revisions a resource has. This can be
problematic when using the 'mutate' option of Cloudkitty. Therefore,
we proposed this option to allow operators to discard all
datapoints returned from Gnocchi, but the last one in the
granularity queried by CloudKitty. The default behavior is
maintained, which means, CloudKitty always use all of the data
points returned.

Change-Id: I051ae1fa3ef6ace9aa417f4ccdca929dab0274b2

commit_message:
stabilize unit test asserting log

The test_get_guest_cpu_config_host_passthrough_with_extra_flags asserts
that no WARNING log is emited during the unit test case, but the
LibvirtDriver itself could emit an unrelated WARNING log sometimes
during the test making the test fail.

This patch moves the mocking and the assert closer together to avoid the
race in the log.

Change-Id: I91667a95afd2a1c1ad53afaf4755224f831b52f6

commit_message:
Custom fields in summary get API

Currently, only the quantity and price are returned in the v2 summary get API.
However, that might not satisfy all user's needs. This PR Enables custom fields
to be used in the Summary get API; thus, we start to allow users/operators/business
people to create richer reports via the summary Get API.

Change-Id: Id4dd83d0703ec0dff32510e6dd1d2dad9b181306

[{'created': '2020-10-02 18:54:19.000000000', 'message': 'Increase cost fields to 28 digits precision

When working with some type of resources, and for some specific billing
requirements, we need to set costs that will use up to more than 8 digits on
the right side of the comma. By default, the Python object Decimal support 28
digits. Therefore, it makes sense for us to change the MySQL database schema
of CloudKitty to use 28 digits as well on the right side. This will avoid
confusion for people when using this feature.

One can argue that using the `factor` option can also be a solution for that,
but as I mentioned, for people used to Python, that can cause confusions
because the MySQL DB is using a different precision than the one supported in
Python for the data type we use to represent the `cost` field.

Change-Id: Ifbf5b2515c7eaf470b48f2695d1e45eeab708a72

commit_message:
Increase cost fields to 28 digits precision

When working with some type of resources, and for some specific billing
requirements, we need to set costs that will use up to more than 8 digits on
the right side of the comma. By default, the Python object Decimal support 28
digits. Therefore, it makes sense for us to change the MySQL database schema
of CloudKitty to use 28 digits as well on the right side. This will avoid
confusion for people when using this feature.

One can argue that using the `factor` option can also be a solution for that,
but as I mentioned, for people used to Python, that can cause confusions
because the MySQL DB is using a different precision than the one supported in
Python for the data type we use to represent the `cost` field.

Change-Id: Ifbf5b2515c7eaf470b48f2695d1e45eeab708a72

commit_message:
stabilize set_host libvirt driver unit test

The test_set_host_enabled* unit tests are setting host state and
asserting the result, but the libvirt driver connection handler also
sets that in parallel in the unit test. Causing these test to be
unstable.

This patch mocks the connection handler to stabilize the tests.

Change-Id: I68ed46d174bf151dbcb91568908c815584985a59

commit_message:
Fix `create_threshold` method when using cost as 0

When using 0 as the cost, the `create_threshold` method
throws an exception. That happens because 0 (zero) is evaluated
to False. Therefore, we need to change the validation method to
check if the values are None.

Change-Id: Iedd541c0ad16db0d11d6e6de332eddf880af1698

subject: Ensure that Endpoints are discovered for openstack-upgrade
messages:
[{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-12-17 12:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2020-12-22 15:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This should really be two commits - one for the requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt change to get the tox runs working and the other for os_principle_actions.py.

That being said, I will go ahead and land this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 12:19:22.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that Endpoints are discovered for openstack-upgrade

Charms that use the openstack-upgrade action have the option (by
default in charms.openstack) to re-render their configuration files
after the packages have been upgraded.  If that charm has interfaces
that are based on the charms.reactive Endpoint class, then they need to
be discovered by the charms.reactive framework so that they can be
'found' by the from_flag() function when constructing an adapters
instance for the render function in charms.openstack (and ultimately
charm-helpers as a context).,  This involves running the
hookenv._run_atstart() function.

Closes-Bug: #1908267
Change-Id: Idfeac39b6d9974bcbbe1891623ff09cc447d87bb
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that Endpoints are discovered for openstack-upgrade

Charms that use the openstack-upgrade action have the option (by
default in charms.openstack) to re-render their configuration files
after the packages have been upgraded.  If that charm has interfaces
that are based on the charms.reactive Endpoint class, then they need to
be discovered by the charms.reactive framework so that they can be
'found' by the from_flag() function when constructing an adapters
instance for the render function in charms.openstack (and ultimately
charm-helpers as a context).,  This involves running the
hookenv._run_atstart() function.

Closes-Bug: #1908267
Change-Id: Idfeac39b6d9974bcbbe1891623ff09cc447d87bb

commit_message:
Do not require coverage and hacking when running tests

Both are not needed for running tests.
This is useful for packaging environments where you usually want to
keep the BuildRequires as minimal as possible.

Change-Id: I09e39b5f84abe9bcc4ec6884a38e31f2d310deb4

subject: devstack: Use newer kafka version 2.1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-01-11 15:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

During Dublin PTG we have agreed together with Kolla project to use version 1.0.1. In the meantime Kolla has bumped to version 1.0.2.

If we want to upgrade Kafka, we should discuss it with the team.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-19 06:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> During Dublin PTG we have agreed together with Kolla project to use
 > version 1.0.1. In the meantime Kolla has bumped to version 1.0.2.
 > 
 > If we want to upgrade Kafka, we should discuss it with the team.

I created https://review.openstack.org/631913 to update the kolla kafka version, too. Let's see if that is enough. Otherwise I can start a discussion via the ML."}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-23 07:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kolla change got a workflow+1. So this one can be merged imo'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-24 05:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Kolla change got a workflow+1. So this one can be merged imo

Kolla change merged. So Kolla uses now kafka version 2.1.0'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-29 11:43:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I haven't had a chance to test Kafka 2.x yet - how much testing has been done? I'm surprised the Kolla change got merged, previously we blocked it pending more testing:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587274/"}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-29 12:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I haven't had a chance to test Kafka 2.x yet - how much testing has
 > been done? 

Not a lot. I used it locally a bit and the CI passes. But why would we handle kafka version bumps different to all the other 100+ components which are updated on a regular base? If somebody detects major problems with the new version, we can a) fix it or b) revert it. And you are still not enforced to use a newer kafka version. This is just the version that is used by devstack..."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-29 14:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't like the idea of bumping major versions and hoping for the best. I think this change needs more testing and discussion at a team meeting."}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-29 15:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I don't like the idea of bumping major versions and hoping for the
 > best. I think this change needs more testing and discussion at a
 > team meeting.

It's not "hoping for the best". The CI proved that the new version works.
I don't have the bandwith todo performance testing for different kafka versions.
Should I abandon this change then?'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-01-29 17:08:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Doug's point that this is a major version number bump is valid.  I wouldn't abandon it, but we can try to arrange a bit more testing before we merge it."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-01-30 10:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-31 12:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2020-12-22 15:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make gnocchiclient an optional requirement

To be able to avoid any Gnocchi dependency, make the client
installation optional and skip the tests if the client is not
installed.

Change-Id: I9651da664714a55e05cd68c308e70442a34d6af5

commit_message:
Switch to openstackdocstheme

The current code does not work with python3.7 on openSUSE
Tumbleweed. It fails with:

Exception occurred:
  File ".tox/docs/lib/python3.7/site-packages/oslosphinx/__init__.py", \
    line 76, in builder_inited
    app.info('Using openstack theme from %s' % theme_dir)
AttributeError: 'Sphinx' object has no attribute 'info'

Switching to openstackdocstheme and also calling sphinx-build directly
instead of relying on the pbr doc build integration fixes that problem.

Also sync test-requirements.txt with global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6def2f7006fedfe57f9736c75abbf082294e635e

commit_message:
Drop glance-cache-manage entrypoint from setup.cfg

Commit 3dde3204d5c1b5323db dropped the command already but when
installing glance, the executable (/usr/bin/glance-cache-manage
usually) was still created because the entrypoint console script was
still there. Removing the entrypoint fixes this.

Note: This change is only needed for stable/rocky because
glance/cmd/cache_manage.py was readded in commit
d03e80a7359349d3 which is available in stable/stein and master.

Change-Id: Ia4e1c598bb7d43e8219bc8de99420f257a825d2d
Closes-Bug: #1840427

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cloudkitty/+/706358

Change-Id: Ieddc84ca5fb13cd1936147a27e450626933f94bb

subject: Update lower-constraints

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 18:41:34.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Cleanup drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

this removes some cruft that can be removed now:
* old requirements
* cruft in setup.cfg and setup.py
* add +ignore_basepython_conflict to tox.ini
* remove install_command and move constraints into deps

Change-Id: I13daab9e53617266beff7053e50779d1f281802c

'}, {'created': '2020-02-24 19:56:54.000000000', 'message': 'Update lower-constraints

This repo has not been testing lower-constraints at all due to
broken install_command. If you look at any lower-constraints run and
compare the install python packages with lower-constraints, you see
that those are completely different.

This change removes install_command and updates deps in tox.ini to
follow best practices (moving constraints into deps).
It also updates lower-constraints to newer versions.

Remove broken hacking test.

Change-Id: I13daab9e53617266beff7053e50779d1f281802c

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints

This repo has not been testing lower-constraints at all due to
broken install_command. If you look at any lower-constraints run and
compare the install python packages with lower-constraints, you see
that those are completely different.

This change removes install_command and updates deps in tox.ini to
follow best practices (moving constraints into deps).
It also updates lower-constraints to newer versions.

Remove broken hacking test.

Co-Authored-By: Justin Ferrieu <jferrieu@objectif-libre.com>
Change-Id: I13daab9e53617266beff7053e50779d1f281802c

[{'created': '2020-10-22 18:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Retry _copy_image_to_volume if VolumeIsBusy

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775

commit_message:
RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to py3 methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ia53c2bd14b23d9a4a6a9c9ae804fa3dd4d4fc3e5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for wallaby supported pythons

The wallaby PTI specifies python 3.6 and 3.8 as the supported
wallaby versions.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-10 15:36:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add timeout default to execute command

This patch adds a reasonable timeout (10 minutes) to all commands
executed using process_utils.execute.

This is useful in current release to make sure that if a processes hangs
it doesn't get stuck there forever.

For older releases, where privsep could only process a single request at
a time, it's even more helpful, because it means it will "automatically"
unblock privsep requests after 10 minutes if a process gets stuck.

Change-Id: I2a42ede824c4b0d0d7b3e4eefefabd64714604eb
'}]
commit_message:
Add timeout default to execute command

This patch adds a reasonable timeout (10 minutes) to all commands
executed using process_utils.execute.

This is useful in current release to make sure that if a processes hangs
it doesn't get stuck there forever.

For older releases, where privsep could only process a single request at
a time, it's even more helpful, because it means it will "automatically"
unblock privsep requests after 10 minutes if a process gets stuck.

Change-Id: I2a42ede824c4b0d0d7b3e4eefefabd64714604eb

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug #1899649

NOTE(lyarwood): The following changes were required on stable/train:

* test_failure_to_build_with_az_and_host must now wait until the volume
  attachments are removed from the fixture as prior to Ussuri instances
  are placed into an ERROR state ahead of volume attachments being
  removed.

* Added TestVolAttachmentsAfterFailureToScheduleOrBuild to super()

* Added ADMIN_API = True

Related-Bug: #1899649
Change-Id: If795b603d812917c9257ee5166a979c1fd6687f3
(cherry picked from commit 770c139edbd2a2c90d6cb2915948e1718dd1deca)
(cherry picked from commit c860b92cf7b2ae63138a83728b788ffdc64145f9)
(cherry picked from commit b1812aa18db793b50a682b995e0ae24f6fe23cfa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-04 10:37:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cinder-manage <category> traceback

Running the cinder-manage command with a category but without an action
will throw a Traceback saying "oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError: no such
option action_fn in group [DEFAULT]"

Example command that triggers this: cinder-manage backup

This patch fixes this by simulating that the user had used the --help
action while still exitting with an error (after all the call was
missing arguments).

New output:

  $ cinder-manage backup

  usage: cinder-manage backup [-h] {list,update_backup_host} ...

  positional arguments:
    {list,update_backup_host}

    optional arguments:
      -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Closes-Bug: #1902852
Change-Id: I6fca54d95b41d189545789c775e23223abb37c1b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder-manage <category> traceback

Running the cinder-manage command with a category but without an action
will throw a Traceback saying "oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError: no such
option action_fn in group [DEFAULT]"

Example command that triggers this: cinder-manage backup

This patch fixes this by simulating that the user had used the --help
action while still exitting with an error (after all the call was
missing arguments).

New output:

  $ cinder-manage backup

  usage: cinder-manage backup [-h] {list,update_backup_host} ...

  positional arguments:
    {list,update_backup_host}

    optional arguments:
      -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Closes-Bug: #1902852
Change-Id: I6fca54d95b41d189545789c775e23223abb37c1b

commit_message:
Pure Storage - bump version numbers for Wallaby

Pure uses the version number of the driver to identify which
customers are using which versions of OpenStack.

This will help granular analysis of which driver is being
used in each OpenStack version.

Change-Id: I43e2909d92cf8b4f3db05bd4da2e0238f9613b99

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25402, 'name': 'Francesco Pantano', 'email': 'fpantano@redhat.com', 'username': 'fmount'}]

[{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-10-23 10:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-10-23 11:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-10-23 13:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-10-23 17:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thank you Giulio! this looks like a great solution. However, being as unfamiliar with deprecation policies as I am, thinking out loud:

This specification effectively makes ceph-nfs a TripleO service (much like the "tripleo-ceph-clients" orchestration proposed in https://review.opendev.org/757644/. If cephadm evolves to deploy nfs-ganesha with HA the way tripleo users would expect it to, what would be our stance?

We want cephadm to cover all three cases: collocation on OpenStack nodes (hyperconverged), collocation with OpenStack services on dedicated Ceph nodes (integrated) and external ceph. This needs to happen for us to consider relying on cephadm's own tooling, and even then, we may want to give deployers a choice to switchover, since, NFS-Ganesha is on the data path and will invariably cause disruption when we decommission it --- this piece is critical, and I want to understand the changes needed in manila to make such a switchover. We'll begin brainstorming this.

If cephadm never adds support to deploy nfs-ganesha in an HA fashion (active/passive or active/active); we'll be good maintaining this code in tripleo-ceph forever, and evolve it as we would any other TripleO service.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-10-26 14:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for thinking this through and writing it down, Giulio!'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-10-27 04:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-10-27 14:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-10-28 16:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-09 18:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-11-09 20:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

wait before merging this one as we look into the possibility to close the gap with ceph-ansible in cephadm directly'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-11-09 20:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

also thanks Alex for reviewing and the feedback during PTG

this remains our best failover plan'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-03 18:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Workflow-1
> 
> wait before merging this one as we look into the possibility to close the gap with ceph-ansible in cephadm directly

I think we can now update (and then work on merging this spec) because we're going to adopt cephadm to run the standalone container."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-12-04 17:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-12-07 15:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-12-07 15:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-12-07 16:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

I made some wording/organization suggestions but like this overall, so thanks!

I wonder if we can fix the test limitation.  Deployments with Ganesha and the extra isolated network are testable downstream using InfraRed and upstream TripleO should be at least as capable ???'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-12-10 12:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
CI: fix race condition in kolla-ansible-host-vars role tests

A temporary file is removed by multiple test hosts, which all have
connection=local. This leads to a race between multiple executions of
the file module on localhost.

Add run_once.

Change-Id: I976122f72bdca7f91cbfcd81fca431b81a6b6aef

commit_message:
Fix Python setup when venv is not used

Set packages argument explicitly as a list to avoid "No package matching
'<generator object select_or_reject at 0x7ff25f341750>' is available" error.

Story: 2008378
Task: 41298
Change-Id: Ibe44583cb93b7dca8f5091c893386a15288af915
(cherry picked from commit e748faea00346aeb1a05a1810a386b1f3d21fa75)

commit_message:
Add name and enabled param in ListDomain parser

when doing openstack domain list --name xyz_id,
and openstack domain list --enabled CLI raising
error unrecognized arguments, whereas in api-ref
document [1], user can pass name and enabled as
optional query param. This addresses the above
issue, by adding param --name and --enabled in
parser of ListDomain.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/?expanded=list-domains-detail#list-domains

Change-Id: I3cdb511d3c7059ddfb802ca025188d8976c9302c

commit_message:
Add option to filter instances by AZ

Since nova API microversion 2.83 it is possible for users to filter
instances by AZ. However even before that this functionality was available
for admin role.

Change-Id: Ife4c8e81aad2ff1dde50d9f23913d9dd9397b00c

subject: CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-25 16:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-26 14:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-12-18 12:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-12-22 12:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nRolled into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/767599'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-25 16:28:24.000000000', 'message': 'CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)

SoC firmware, from the ramdisk as these devices are unlikely

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I6a15585b84d78f2bc343309da24cc4409940a79b

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

For Train also fix the reqs to pass the checks.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I7d1595c1dc3eb834f3b13b11f608b90aaff1d349
(cherry picked from commit 40fc3c10ed70e3d705c517d941c40cdfedfced2f)

subject: CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-25 16:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-26 14:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-12-18 12:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-12-22 09:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nRolled into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/767597'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-25 16:27:37.000000000', 'message': 'CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)

commit_message:
Install iptables in ironic-inspector container

The centos environment ironic-inspector use iptables filter need
install iptables rpm package.

Change-Id: I67081a37977dd6de37a67fcd012e002f2e46743f
Closes-bug: #1906635

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I7d1595c1dc3eb834f3b13b11f608b90aaff1d349
(cherry picked from commit 40fc3c10ed70e3d705c517d941c40cdfedfced2f)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I6a3fa44983203127904ca93be7a1ce3245f6dee5

messages: [{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-12-16 06:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-12-21 15:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-12-21 20:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-12-21 20:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nfailed in gate'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-12-21 20:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-16 06:45:30.000000000', 'message': 'Map build host repos to distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d

Currently, when building container images, we are overriding the ubi
image repos with the repos configured in the host. Effectively, this is
removing ubi repo config from the image build environment which most of
the times is not a problem as centos is on sync with ubi, but in some
cases as after RHEL 8.3 release, ubi is ahead of CentOS and need
packages from the ubi repo itself.

This patch is bind mounting the repos config from build host in
distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d. In that way, both the repos
configured by default in the image (ubi repos) and the ones in the host
are available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/765077
Closes-Bug: #1902846
Change-Id: I55f4b8cf2ad971e196fbd06db743d07ce3135ea8
(cherry picked from commit a4fdf46d83a91e8cbe8f40abc79d94a1c31dc592)
'}]
commit_message:
Map build host repos to distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d

Currently, when building container images, we are overriding the ubi
image repos with the repos configured in the host. Effectively, this is
removing ubi repo config from the image build environment which most of
the times is not a problem as centos is on sync with ubi, but in some
cases as after RHEL 8.3 release, ubi is ahead of CentOS and need
packages from the ubi repo itself.

This patch is bind mounting the repos config from build host in
distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d. In that way, both the repos
configured by default in the image (ubi repos) and the ones in the host
are available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/765077
Closes-Bug: #1902846
Change-Id: I55f4b8cf2ad971e196fbd06db743d07ce3135ea8
(cherry picked from commit a4fdf46d83a91e8cbe8f40abc79d94a1c31dc592)

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints for new pip

This patch bump a series of lower-constraints and
requirements to work with new pip resolver. For
more information please refer [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019285.html

Change-Id: I065737b2e2d87de1485c77725ebcd08f97953096

commit_message:
The lower constraint file has been removed

This file, and its tests, are not useful for tripleo so we're
removing because they're now becoming problematic.

Change-Id: I4207e7f543f33dda640bf0784e54311c66ba4e30
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set setgid mode bit for /var/lib/ironic

This will allow folders and files created in that folder
(i.e for /var/lib/ironic/images/*) to have the same group
ID (42422) and hence no permission issues.

Related-Bug: #1907272
Change-Id: Ib2ca2ca46ff4efa419b6b9236299e70b39f8639e
(cherry picked from commit d582c097cf35be2dcc9a9a9eee5639ce6aace8c7)
(cherry picked from commit 7228eb32afbd866f5123fd95904ab1faf2d13000)

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-12-20 07:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-12-21 12:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-12-21 17:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-20 07:53:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nic selection when no nic is specified

This is a way to reinstate change
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/761833 which was
supposed to remove a workaround for VIP selection on IPv6. Turns out
the workaround is still needed because the resource-agent for IPaddr2
is still problematic with IPv6:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1902851

With this change we still force a nic when using ipv6 except in the
case a user specifies the nic via the tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic
hiera key.

Tested this and I can correctly bind the VIPs as expected:
    tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
    force_vip_nic_overrides:
      redis_vip: vlan20
      ovn_dbs_vip: vlan20

[root@controller-2 ~]# grep -ir ovn_dbs_v /etc/puppet/hieradata/
/etc/puppet/hieradata/all_nodes.json:    "ovn_dbs_vip": "172.17.1.107",
/etc/puppet/hieradata/extraconfig.json:        "ovn_dbs_vip": "vlan20",
[root@controller-2 ~]# ip -o a |grep 17.1.107/32
10: vlan20    inet 172.17.1.107/32 brd 172.17.1.255 scope global vlan20\
    valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Change-Id: I14bfaf0060093811cddf0cdd9a130b91a3cd0477
(cherry picked from commit c47aa021f06ed201918c7bcf75cdbc073fe665b8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nic selection when no nic is specified

This is a way to reinstate change
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/761833 which was
supposed to remove a workaround for VIP selection on IPv6. Turns out
the workaround is still needed because the resource-agent for IPaddr2
is still problematic with IPv6:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1902851

With this change we still force a nic when using ipv6 except in the
case a user specifies the nic via the tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic
hiera key.

Tested this and I can correctly bind the VIPs as expected:
    tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
    force_vip_nic_overrides:
      redis_vip: vlan20
      ovn_dbs_vip: vlan20

[root@controller-2 ~]# grep -ir ovn_dbs_v /etc/puppet/hieradata/
/etc/puppet/hieradata/all_nodes.json:    "ovn_dbs_vip": "172.17.1.107",
/etc/puppet/hieradata/extraconfig.json:        "ovn_dbs_vip": "vlan20",
[root@controller-2 ~]# ip -o a |grep 17.1.107/32
10: vlan20    inet 172.17.1.107/32 brd 172.17.1.255 scope global vlan20\
    valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Change-Id: I14bfaf0060093811cddf0cdd9a130b91a3cd0477
(cherry picked from commit c47aa021f06ed201918c7bcf75cdbc073fe665b8)

Update the cinder-lvm-losetup systemd service to wait until the local
/var directory is mounted and the lvm2-monitor service has started

Make LIO SCSI target data persistent by adding container volume mounts
for the /etc/target directory so that the data is stored on the host.

(cherry picked from commit 63b2a989ba4a79c204c6d2a4b1512e3a924ec434)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure cinder LVM volumes work after system restart

Update the cinder-lvm-losetup systemd service to wait until the local
/var directory is mounted and the lvm2-monitor service has started
prior to creating the loopback device used by cinder's LVM backend.

Make LIO SCSI target data persistent by adding container volume mounts
for the /etc/target directory so that the data is stored on the host.

Closes-Bug: #1905617
Change-Id: I0c0cbed3a41e8d4b1fbaf5c2dc7fd0412fee644a
(cherry picked from commit 63b2a989ba4a79c204c6d2a4b1512e3a924ec434)

commit_message:
Include default forwarder address in all cases for IPA

IPA jobs are using the local forwarder and not resolving all
cases. This review adds back the default fowarder to the list
of acceptable forwarders in the IPA server setup.

Change-Id: I6dfa5d172c6fb5c94c1dd4315faf5b4e79ab6d16

commit_message:
Rely on the HOSTNAME var to resolve the mon container name

We previously used the {{ ansible_hostname }} variable as a replacement
for ${HOSTNAME} when the ceph-mon container name needed to be resolved
during the FFU process.
However, sounds like {{ ansible_hostname }} doesn't return the value of
the delegated host [1].
The purpose of this change is to compute the hostname relying on the
exported env var and it's supposed to fix the tls-everywhere use case
(when a more complex domain is provided).

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/14958

Closes-Bug: #1903537
Change-Id: I77e3e5e4336a5d3f76b10d09cf7034023fbec075

[{'created': '2020-12-16 07:13:59.000000000', 'message': "Defauts mariadb's innodb_strict_mode to OFF

Recent mariadb (e.g. 10.3.27) added more DDL checks such as table
create/alter checks and table size checks which conflict with the
schema of a few OpenStack services after a FFU has upgraded the
database without changing the row format in use.

Since no data seems to be impacted, as an immediate measure,
force the innodb_strict_mode to OFF to ensure that all the db_sync
operations can succeed, until we come up with a permanent fix.

Closes-Bug: #1908232

Change-Id: I046dbbb0ffca935119c36d301c2ab7dba469de9c
"}]
commit_message:
Defauts mariadb's innodb_strict_mode to OFF

Recent mariadb (e.g. 10.3.27) added more DDL checks such as table
create/alter checks and table size checks which conflict with the
schema of a few OpenStack services after a FFU has upgraded the
database without changing the row format in use.

Since no data seems to be impacted, as an immediate measure,
force the innodb_strict_mode to OFF to ensure that all the db_sync
operations can succeed, until we come up with a permanent fix.

Closes-Bug: #1908232

Change-Id: I046dbbb0ffca935119c36d301c2ab7dba469de9c

commit_message:
Add file which enables QoS related L3 agent extensions

It enables extensions like fip_qos and gateway_ip_qos in the
L3 agent.

Related-Bug: #1900357

Change-Id: I88ae631c299f408bdedcb80bd5c04e36fda5a2e1
(cherry picked from commit d910b9486e31bc50d72d671c3c078585e689efd0)

commit_message:
Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Also:
merges https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/763623
into this patch to not have a dedicated fix needed.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)
(cherry picked from commit c352a78fe0ceef2a77728c46bb08ac4f12217842)

commit_message:
Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Also:

into this patch to not have a dedicated fix needed.

commit_message:
Update requirements URLs in tox config

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so will switch to the correct
upper-constraints list automatically when the requirements repository branches.

Change-Id: I3574a98b63a641454828ad6711d2153eb3216757

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-16 06:44:31.000000000', 'message': 'Map build host repos to distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d

Currently, when building container images, we are overriding the ubi
image repos with the repos configured in the host. Effectively, this is
removing ubi repo config from the image build environment which most of
the times is not a problem as centos is on sync with ubi, but in some
cases as after RHEL 8.3 release, ubi is ahead of CentOS and need
packages from the ubi repo itself.

This patch is bind mounting the repos config from build host in
distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d. In that way, both the repos
configured by default in the image (ubi repos) and the ones in the host
are available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/765076
Closes-Bug: #1902846
Change-Id: I55f4b8cf2ad971e196fbd06db743d07ce3135ea8
(cherry picked from commit a4fdf46d83a91e8cbe8f40abc79d94a1c31dc592)

(cherry picked from commit a4fdf46d83a91e8cbe8f40abc79d94a1c31dc592)
'}]
commit_message:
Map build host repos to distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d

Currently, when building container images, we are overriding the ubi
image repos with the repos configured in the host. Effectively, this is
removing ubi repo config from the image build environment which most of
the times is not a problem as centos is on sync with ubi, but in some
cases as after RHEL 8.3 release, ubi is ahead of CentOS and need
packages from the ubi repo itself.

This patch is bind mounting the repos config from build host in
distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d. In that way, both the repos
configured by default in the image (ubi repos) and the ones in the host
are available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/765076
Closes-Bug: #1902846
Change-Id: I55f4b8cf2ad971e196fbd06db743d07ce3135ea8
(cherry picked from commit a4fdf46d83a91e8cbe8f40abc79d94a1c31dc592)

commit_message:
Add NovaApiMaxLimit configure max_limit for nova

Currently, we can't set Nova [api]/max_limit
using a supplied Heat parameter. This change
adds a Heat parameter that will make it easier
for users to configure max_limit in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I4c28c6c90c52f22d4fa81d13e85842ce876ec2b9
closes-bug: 1904096
(cherry picked from commit 603530c711323d09b68b1a73a5fc7c61cfb6b42a)

[{'created': '2020-12-14 09:49:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I5ee74ac490cfe1c3152b73c352dd185e6304c8bd
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I5ee74ac490cfe1c3152b73c352dd185e6304c8bd

commit_message:
Remove six.text_type (2/2)

Replace six.text_type with str.
This patch completes six removal.

Change-Id: I779bd1446dc1f070fa5100ccccda7881fa508d79
Implements: blueprint six-removal
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 14:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove six.text_type (1/2)

Replace six.text_type with str.
Remove the following hacking rule.

  N325 str() and unicode() cannot be used on an exception.
       Remove or use six.text_type()

A subsequent patch will replace other six.text_type.

Change-Id: I23bb9e539d08f5c6202909054c2dd49b6c7a7a0e
Implements: blueprint six-removal
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 11:46:33.000000000', 'message': 'scenario: Remove volume detach cleanup from nova_volume_attach

Introduced by Ibeca23781c16417ee031bc975305429af79d9b4a this cleanup
actually duplicates volume detach requests made either through cleanups
already present in the tests or actual volume detach requests made as
part of the tests.

This results in a race between the requests to detach the volume that
often leads to failure as the volume has already been detached from the
instance.

This change simply removes the cleanup from nova_volume_attach and
relies on the existing logic within the tests to detach the volume when
required.

Closes-Bug: #1908399
Change-Id: Ib6ae2c30be65eb444976b0330fd23d9457146284
'}, {'created': '2020-12-21 16:05:47.000000000', 'message': 'scenario: Use wait_for_volume_attachment_remove_from_server in nova_volume_detach

Detaching a volume from an instance in Nova is an asynchronous
operation. While the request can be accepted the underlying act of
detaching the device from the instance, disconnecting the volume from
the host, updating cinder and deleting records in Nova can take some
considerable time.

As such when detaching a volume callers should continue to poll the
os-volume_attachments Nova API to determine when the underlying volume
attachment, also known as a Block Device Mapping or BDM, is removed.

Bug #1908399 outlines an issue where the scenario helper method
nova_volume_detach was being called multiple times during tests and
cleanup while only waiting for the volume status to change to available.
This allowed for a race to occur where additional requests could be made
to detach the volume while the volume attachment still remained in Nova
resulting in a 400 error being returned by n-api.

This change addresses this by switching between the volume resource
status and the volume attachment removal waiters.

Closes-Bug: #1908399
Change-Id: Ib6ae2c30be65eb444976b0330fd23d9457146284
'}]
commit_message:
scenario: Use wait_for_volume_attachment_remove_from_server in nova_volume_detach

Detaching a volume from an instance in Nova is an asynchronous
operation. While the request can be accepted the underlying act of
detaching the device from the instance, disconnecting the volume from
the host, updating cinder and deleting records in Nova can take some
considerable time.

As such when detaching a volume callers should continue to poll the
os-volume_attachments Nova API to determine when the underlying volume
attachment, also known as a Block Device Mapping or BDM, is removed.

Bug #1908399 outlines an issue where the scenario helper method
nova_volume_detach was being called multiple times during tests and
cleanup while only waiting for the volume status to change to available.
This allowed for a race to occur where additional requests could be made
to detach the volume while the volume attachment still remained in Nova
resulting in a 400 error being returned by n-api.

This change addresses this by switching between the volume resource
status and the volume attachment removal waiters.

Closes-Bug: #1908399
Change-Id: Ib6ae2c30be65eb444976b0330fd23d9457146284

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-10 21:47:39.000000000', 'message': "Stop installing test-requirements with projects

This is a test of installing openstack and then seeing if it works.
OpenStack components do not need test-requirements to operate,
that's why they are test-requirements.

Additionally, as we look forward to depsolver pip, this is going

commit_message:
Stop installing test-requirements with projects

This is a test of installing openstack and then seeing if it works.
OpenStack components do not need test-requirements to operate,
that's why they are test-requirements.

Additionally, as we look forward to depsolver pip, this is going
to screw us because we don't apply constraints to linters, which
are expressed in - you guessed it, test-requirements.

NOTE(lyarwood): openstacksdk-functional is currently failing due to
I1e151454f39d51db52cdc7a23dbdcbf9b28c9381 not being present in
stable/train. Unfortunatley the backport of this fix is held up by
multiple other failures in other projects caused by the new pip
dependency resolver behaviour. To fix these we first need to land
I8f24b839bf42e2fb9803dc7df3a30ae20cf264eb in devstack on stable/train,
allowing fixes to land in these projects that should eventually fix
openstacksdk.

To allow this we need to temporarily mark the openstacksdk-functional
job as non-voting.

Change-Id: I8f24b839bf42e2fb9803dc7df3a30ae20cf264eb
(cherry picked from commit 09b5b05c471985ad53c4b321e993101f007ee915)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated [placement]/policy_file config option

[placement]/policy_file config option is deprecated since Train
release in favor of ``[oslo_policy]/policy_file`` config option.

In wallaby cycle, default value of ``[oslo_policy]/policy_file``
is going to change to 'policy.yaml' so it is better to remove
the old deprecated config option to avoid confusion for operator.

Change-Id: I427f1f5a82dc1b2e27fa29b68db9ab549df92289

commit_message:
Also calculate external subnets when check cidr whether in use

The external network be shared by all tenant. When it associated
to a tenant router the cidr of it's subnets cannot overlap with
tenant subnets', otherwise it will lead to bug #1903433. The related
fix patch: https://review.opendev.org/761829

So, in tempest, the external subnets need was considered when check
cidr whether in use.

Related-Bug: #1903433
Change-Id: Ief84251adb0368533570d9e9f6630de92e27c5c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 18:02:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

Story: 2008429
Task: 41378

Change-Id: Ie8fd965165e8d347d27528a2c16d0647e412ccdc
(cherry picked from commit 4398856ec80ae765e805df9aab7d6f2105a34009)

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,

  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python

'}, {'created': '2020-12-18 17:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

Also includes a backport of the following change:

Fix sphinx8 script used by pep8

We wrap doc8 to register the directives we use in our documentation.
Previously the 'app' argument was passed as None, however sphinx has
started to use the argument.

This change uses a mock object since we don't need to use the
application object.

Backported Change-Id: Id9e8d5f6d09f14d294cd493538780456f98c7dbe
(cherry picked from commit 2fcdff101f888ac310969e4e5e0f2e409288a71d)

commit_message:
Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies due to the pip resolver. Remove upper limits from docker
  and paramiko. molecule is only required for the molecule tox
  environment, which is Python 2.

Also includes a backport of the following change:

Fix sphinx8 script used by pep8

We wrap doc8 to register the directives we use in our documentation.
Previously the 'app' argument was passed as None, however sphinx has
started to use the argument.

This change uses a mock object since we don't need to use the
application object.

Backported Change-Id: Id9e8d5f6d09f14d294cd493538780456f98c7dbe
(cherry picked from commit 2fcdff101f888ac310969e4e5e0f2e409288a71d)

Task: 41378

Change-Id: Ie8fd965165e8d347d27528a2c16d0647e412ccdc
(cherry picked from commit 4398856ec80ae765e805df9aab7d6f2105a34009)

commit_message:
Remove Tony from list of election officials

Tony has asked me to remove him from the election officials list.
Many thanks for his tireless work on this over the years!

Change-Id: I276b7ee2a1323c35c5d789e195dd6a71878310d8

commit_message:
Fix the order of arguments to tar

tar needs the filename to appear after the 'f' option.

Closes-bug: #1905406

Change-Id: I7d0539ce736e34639dbd6600351c4b269c4fff2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 17:54:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but Bifrost has enabled authentication by
  default. We are not ready to support this, so override it.

  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

This change also includes the following backport:

CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Backport Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)

commit_message:
Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

This change also includes the following backport:

CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Backport Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
(cherry picked from commit 0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94)

Story: 2008429
Task: 41378

Change-Id: Ie8fd965165e8d347d27528a2c16d0647e412ccdc
(cherry picked from commit 4398856ec80ae765e805df9aab7d6f2105a34009)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per our PTG resolution [1] and general OpenStack resolution [2], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/018445.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I58807c27fd20c7269019e26e8b507744d35325f3

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also convert the neutron_lib/tests/etc/policy.json and
neutron_lib/tests/etc/dummy_policy.json to policy.yaml
file. Replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I63a41a21784fa6ce6d9c249f41991c0df3346135

commit_message:
Add const for ports bulk resource extenders

Will be used to apply extend funcs to port lists rather then
for individual ports for efficiency.
Needed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763777

Related-Bug: #1905268
Change-Id: I1578c5cbd303d5f17a182a74911cc76136435a6c

[{'created': '2020-12-21 16:50:53.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: Ib13e4f07aa6ee76be329d9eec9180c1fe31b9593
'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per a general OpenStack resolution [1], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: Ib13e4f07aa6ee76be329d9eec9180c1fe31b9593

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-11 03:03:40.000000000', 'message': "Handle None network config

When using custom network configs, if the 'outputs' section is
not correct in the template, there won't be any error in stack
create/update. HostnameNetworkConfigMap would have configs as
null i.e {HOSTNAME: null,} and we'll look for None software
configs using heat api resulting in a traceback not easy to
understand. Let's add a check to notify the user with a proper
error.

This is not required in master and victoria branches, as we've
moved away from using heat software configs for network config.

Change-Id: If79f7051fec4b4f648c4acf9d62474028e0831bd
