commit_message:
[stable] Raise proper error for None network config

When using custom network configs, if the 'outputs' section is
not correct in the template, there won't be any error in stack
create/update. HostnameNetworkConfigMap would have configs as
null i.e {HOSTNAME: null,} and we'll look for None software
configs using heat api resulting in a traceback not easy to
understand. Let's add a check to notify the user with a proper
error.

This is not required in master and victoria branches, as we've
moved away from using heat software configs for network config.

Closes-Bug: #1907746
Change-Id: If79f7051fec4b4f648c4acf9d62474028e0831bd

Consolidate tcib build results in a html report running
pytest to check if the containers were built. For each
container image, a test is run to check if the image exists
and a link to the logs is attached to the report.

As part of the container build simplification and usability
improvements, the kolla and tripleo building methods have
been split into separate templates.

This change also removes the dry-runs in the build script that
were supposed to get the list of expected containers. Instead,
we replace the dry-runs with the tripleo_containers.yaml file.

actual built ones.

commit_message:
pytest-html report for tcib container builds

Consolidate tcib build results in a html report running
pytest to check if the containers were built. For each
container image, a test is run to check if the image exists
and a link to the logs is attached to the report.

As part of the container build simplification and usability
improvements, the kolla and tripleo building methods have
been split into separate templates.

This change also removes the dry-runs in the build script that
were supposed to get the list of expected containers. Instead,
we replace the dry-runs with the tripleo_containers.yaml file.
This avoids confusion in counting expected containers vs the
actual built ones.

Change-Id: I1bb9353c2b5c79f55ab39d9cfcaa8f9617c28a34

subject: Remove /etc/ceph dependency and add tripleo_ceph_client role

I see numerous references to '/etc/ceph' in puppet-tripleo. I suspect much of that code is obsolete now that we're using ceph-ansible, but it seems puppet-tripleo needs to be cleaned up regardless. Either the directory references need to be updated, or all of the ceph stuff needs to be removed."}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-11-20 14:45:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I see numerous references to '/etc/ceph' in puppet-tripleo. I
 > suspect much of that code is obsolete now that we're using
 > ceph-ansible, but it seems puppet-tripleo needs to be cleaned up
 > regardless. Either the directory references need to be updated, or
 > all of the ceph stuff needs to be removed.

Hey Alan thanks for looking at this change.
Yes, tht is the first endpoint to provide a new Ceph config path parameter.
The puppet-tripleo work is tracked here [1] and I'm experimenting with Glance at the moment, but we probably need to double check all the services.

At first glance Cinder volume [2] (when the rbd backend is used) should be ok because 'cinder_rbd_ceph_conf' can be set, but I'm still not sure about volume.pp [3] and the changes we need here. 

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763545/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume/rbd.pp

> Patch Set 32:
> 
> I've been working my way though the puppet-tripleo patch, and haven't looked at the new ceph_client ansible role, but both are listed here as depends-on patches. Should this patch be split in two, one for removing /etc/ceph and another for using the ansible role?

They were two different patches at the beginning, but when we had the /etc/ceph dependency requirement we decided to merge the tht patches (it's easy for testing purposes and make sure we're covering all the use cases).
If this is not a blocker at this point I would avoid splitting (again) the two reviews, rebasing one of top of the other within the same project.
wdyt?"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-11-30 18:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

> Patch Set 33:
> 
> > Patch Set 32:
> > 
> > I've been working my way though the puppet-tripleo patch, and haven't looked at the new ceph_client ansible role, but both are listed here as depends-on patches. Should this patch be split in two, one for removing /etc/ceph and another for using the ansible role?
> 
> They were two different patches at the beginning, but when we had the /etc/ceph dependency requirement we decided to merge the tht patches (it's easy for testing purposes and make sure we're covering all the use cases).
> If this is not a blocker at this point I would avoid splitting (again) the two reviews, rebasing one of top of the other within the same project.
> wdyt?

In addition, from a pure tht perspective, we added ceph-base.yml here with the purpose of having the client role tested (it was previously tested in a standalone patch) in combination with the /etc/ceph dependency change, because we want to make sure that no conflicts are generated when the ceph config files (conf and keyrings) are dumped in a specified path, which is then used by kolla_config to copy these files in the /etc/ceph path (within the container)."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-30 18:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

> If this is not a blocker at this point I would avoid splitting (again) the two reviews, rebasing one of top of the other within the same project.

I'm OK keeping these changes in a single patch, it simply reaffirms the ceph_client ansible role is a dependency."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-11-30 22:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-01 08:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-01 08:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

(7 comments)

I'm probably late in offering thoughts like this, but I wonder if the size of the changes to both THT and puppet-tripleo could have been reduced by using a single hiera variable (maybe something like 'ceph_config_path') that is referenced by all the puppet-tripleo resources. This would be in lieu of separate input parameters for each puppet resource, like these:

tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::cinder_rbd_ceph_conf_path
tripleo::profile::base::glance::backend::rbd::glance_rbd_ceph_conf_path
tripleo::profile::base::gnocchi::api::gnocchi_rbd_ceph_conf_path
tripleo::profile::base::nova::compute_libvirt_shared::nova_rbd_ceph_conf_path
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::cinder::backup_bundle::ceph_conf_path
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::cinder::volume_bundle::ceph_conf_path"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-04 07:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-12-04 07:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

This would be in lieu of separate input parameters for each puppet resource, like these:
>

[{'created': '2020-11-20 10:37:27.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Remove /etc/ceph dependency exposing a new parameter

This change introduces a new CephConfigPath parameter
that can be used by all the OpenStack clients when
looking for Ceph client related info (ceph.conf and
keyrings).
Overriding this parameter we can make the containers
able to mount a different path than /etc/ceph wich
was hardcoded.

'}, {'created': '2020-11-26 13:44:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Remove /etc/ceph dependency and add tripleo_ceph_client role

This change introduces a new CephConfigPath parameter that can be used
by all the OpenStack clients when looking for Ceph client related info
(ceph.conf and keyrings).
By overriding this parameter we can make the containers able to pull
data from different path than /etc/ceph wich was hardcoded.
On top of this change, a new bool is added to prevent the ceph-ansible
client role being executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_client' tag is added to the list
of tags that should be skipped in ceph-ansible.
By doing this, ceph-ansible won't run the client role [1] and the new,
tripleo_ceph_client role is imported and executed.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Depends-On: Iaabb66cd26f0246defe391a4e34f4eab3c3c5fee
Depends-On: Ia60bc6d5d1a04bd560f2fcb05a4b64078015ae9d

Change-Id: I36673367411cc8d68ffb9ec4a2fbff64ebf12f29
"}, {'created': '2020-11-26 13:58:45.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Remove /etc/ceph dependency and add tripleo_ceph_client role

By doing this, ceph-ansible won't run the client role [1] and the new,

commit_message:
Remove /etc/ceph dependency and add tripleo_ceph_client role

This change introduces a new CephConfigPath parameter that can be used
by all the OpenStack clients when looking for Ceph client related info
(ceph.conf and keyrings).
By overriding this parameter we can make the containers able to pull
data from different path than /etc/ceph wich was hardcoded.
On top of this change, a new bool is added to prevent the ceph-ansible
client role being executed.
When this boolean is true, the 'ceph_client' tag is added to the list
of tags that should be skipped in ceph-ansible.
By doing this, ceph-ansible won't run the client role [1] and the new,
tripleo_ceph_client role is imported and executed.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/site-container.yml.sample#L269

Depends-On: Iaabb66cd26f0246defe391a4e34f4eab3c3c5fee
Depends-On: Ia60bc6d5d1a04bd560f2fcb05a4b64078015ae9d

Change-Id: I36673367411cc8d68ffb9ec4a2fbff64ebf12f29

commit_message:
Fix overcloud provisioning

Affects master & Victoria only.

Since Victoria, Bifrost added a play to gather facts for localhost at
the beginning of deploy-dynamic.yaml. Kayobe executes the playbook with
a limit, which does not include localhost. This causes fact gathering to
be skipped for localhost:

    PLAY [Gather facts on localhost] ***********************************
      skipping: no hosts matched

This change fixes the issue by adding localhost to the limit.

Change-Id: I1264832398744c48a6f706efe91f084890a37772
Story: 2008388
Task: 41311

Cinder volume deletion is async and can take time to complete in the
c-vol backend *after* c-api has already returned to the caller.

As such we need to wait until encrypted volumes are deleted fully before
attempting to delete the associated encrypted volume type as this

commit_message:
cinder: Wait for encrypted volume to be deleted before removing type

Cinder volume deletion is async and can take time to complete in the
c-vol backend *after* c-api has already returned to the caller.

As such we need to wait until encrypted volumes are deleted fully before
attempting to delete the associated encrypted volume type as this
request will fail when the volume is still being deleted by c-vol.

This change adds a simple waiter to ensure the volume is removed before
removing the type.

Change-Id: I466763ae9fc5a7ad13b498d43b0c16802c1b800b
Closes-Bug: #1907157

commit_message:
Bump the lowest eventlet version to 0.26.1

The dnspython 2.0.0 incompatibility[1] is worked around in eventlet 0.26.1
by restricting the dnspython version to < 2.0.0. So the issue affects
nova-novncproxy as well we need to bump our lower constraint as well.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/619

Related-Bug: #1888237

Change-Id: Ie9cc718e654cb37a4f31ccb4b052b23878d476a2

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Change-Id: Ia627a937c2b2df23b52f6224f560dc6fc6936d7d
Closes-Bug: #1907438

commit_message:
Remove workaround for broken dogpile.cache and lower-constraints file

- dogpile.cache workaround
Bug: https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/issues/178
Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1876073

- The lower-constraints.txt file has been removed because it is not
useful for TripleO anymore.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I00e2e252700d0229113cc6ee1c4efff0504fb005
(cherry picked from commit b8bb9a5f2c6e2e8ca5fb8aea8ed0da5df5464078)

commit_message:
Removing scheduler_default_filters

This setting was renamed enabled_filters a while back. For the sake of
consistency, we need to change this here as well. Another change in THT
will follow this one.

Change-Id: I110f612f1b78899e8969da607e6b400e2e64c8a1

subject: Deprecated the swift_store_config_file parameter
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-21 15:56:04.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecated the swift_store_config_file parameter

Currently we always neeed to set the swift_store_config_file parameter
to use swift backend, so that it points to the file for swift
account(s) configurations. However this is redundant since we use the
hard-coded file name in the glance_swift_config resource, which
manages the swift configurations.
This patch deprecates the parameter and change its default to be
consistent with the glance_swift_config resource.

Change-Id: I18962e2cbc7c75d77cb6a21cdf68e894fe4bf44b
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecated the swift_store_config_file parameter

Currently we always neeed to set the swift_store_config_file parameter
to use swift backend, so that it points to the file for swift
account(s) configurations. However this is redundant since we use the
hard-coded file name in the glance_swift_config resource, which
manages the swift configurations.
This patch deprecates the parameter and change its default to be
consistent with the glance_swift_config resource.

Change-Id: I18962e2cbc7c75d77cb6a21cdf68e894fe4bf44b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-09 22:17:23.000000000', 'message': 'Enable "port_forwarding" feature in neutron ML2 ovs environment

This patch enables port_forwarding service plugin and L3 agent's
extension in case of ML2/OVS environment.
It don't enable it in ML2/OVN cases as networking-ovn don't support
port_forwarding yet.

This patch also adds NeutronL3AgentExtensions config option for
Neutron L3 agent.
This new option is used to enable "port_forwarding" extension on L3
agent.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/neutron-l3.yaml
    environments/services/neutron-ovs.yaml

Change-Id: I2417f9f6a436ae7a3820e16fdf6210099807b651

commit_message:
Enable "port_forwarding" feature in neutron ML2 ovs environment

This patch enables port_forwarding service plugin and L3 agent's
extension in case of ML2/OVS environment.
It don't enable it in ML2/OVN cases as networking-ovn don't support
port_forwarding yet.

This patch also adds NeutronL3AgentExtensions config option for
Neutron L3 agent.
This new option is used to enable "port_forwarding" extension on L3
agent.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/neutron-l3.yaml
    environments/services/neutron-ovs.yaml

Change-Id: I2417f9f6a436ae7a3820e16fdf6210099807b651
(cherry picked from commit 95f889720c2f7e8467cc0f488ad0176dcafffe6a)

commit_message:
Enables SCTPsupport in K8s v1.18 cluster

While we are still using Kubernetes v1.18, this change enables
SCTPSupport in the cluster via features gate.

Change-Id: I985ef66a72183dfacb1cb90841f572aff966ed72

commit_message:
Fallback to same-cell resize with qos ports

The cross-cell resize code does not consider neutron ports with resource
request. To avoid migration failures this patch makes nova to fall back
to same cell resize if the instance has neutron ports with resource
request.

Change-Id: Icaad4b2375b491c8a7e87fb6f4977ae2e13e8190
Closes-Bug: #1907522

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1907522 in functional test

Cross cell resize does not support neutron ports with resource request
as nova fails to send a proper port binding to neutron. This causes the
migration to fail. However we should simply not allow the migration to
go cross cell if the server has such ports.

This patch adds a functional test to reproduce the problem

Change-Id: Id91d2e817ef6bd21124bb840bdb098054e9753b8
Related-Bug: #1907522

commit_message:
Define periodic jobs

We sometimes create gate check changes but periodic jobs can do
most of them, particularly in stable branhces.
This commit is planed to backport to stable branches.
Note that we already have periodic-stable-jobs (for pyXX and docs jobs)
but it is nice to have npm and integration jobs in this coverage.
Once it is available in stable branches, I will configure the Grafana
dashboard to monitor healthiness in stable branches.

Note on stable backport:
In stable branches, we have a pipeline named 'periodic-stable'
and it is used in periodic-stable-jobs template.
It would be nice to use the same pipeline for all periodic jobs.

Change-Id: Ieb2fe4d2c4453e572c9251dc03c34d08bed62a0f
(cherry picked from commit 392bc2482eff851504b245c2e28de00694dd9eb8)
